snippet: A popular measure against insider trading has picked up more than two dozen proposed amendments, to the dismay of its sponsors and Senate leaders.
abstract: Popular Senate bill to ban insider trading by members of Congress, which many expected to pass quickly, has slowed, picking up more than two dozen proposed amendments; most common objection is to provision requiring lawmakers to disclose stock sales and purchases within 30 days of transactions.
lead_paragraph: A popular measure against insider trading has picked up more than two dozen proposed amendments, to the dismay of its sponsors and Senate leaders.

headline.seo: Senators’ Amendments Ensnarl Insider Trading Bill
headline.main: Lure of a Senate Bill Attracts Amendments, Some of Them Relevant
headline.print_headline: Lure of a Senate Bill Attracts Amendments, Some of Them Relevant
